short: Default zoom factor for browser tabs
description: The default zoom level applied to tabs. This is a read-only property obtained from the Chrome Tabs API (chrome.tabs.getZoomSettings). It represents the default zoom factor that the browser applies when a tab's zoom is reset to defaults. The value is retrieved dynamically from the browser's zoom settings and is used as a fallback when resetting zoom levels to their default state. This setting is part of the ZoomSettings type in the Chrome extension API (Chrome 43+).
valueDescription: Decimal number representing the default zoom factor (e.g., 1.0 for 100%, 1.5 for 150%). The default fallback value if not provided by the browser is 1 (100% zoom).

values.description: Standard 100% zoom level (fallback default when browser value is undefined)

notes: This is a browser-provided property, not a user-configurable setting. It is obtained dynamically from the Chrome Tabs API when the setZoom command is triggered with a zoom factor of 0 (which signals a reset to default). The property is optional in the ZoomSettings type, so code includes a conditional check with a fallback value of 1. The actual zoom reset operation uses this value via chrome.tabs.setZoom(tabId, defaultZoom). Different browser profiles or zoom configurations may result in different defaultZoomFactor values.
